alert.note: Alert for Bear River Range; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Marsh and Arbon Highlands (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 19 at 3:35AM MST until February 22 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 18 inches, except 20 to 36 inches on ridge tops and elevations above 6500 feet MSL. Locally higher totals in the Bear River Range. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Inkom, McCammon, Downey, Lava Hot Springs, Emigration Summit, Grace, Soda Springs, Henry, Bone, Wayan, and Swan Valley. * WHEN...From this evening through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Bear River Range; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Marsh and Arbon Highlands
